intro: Paronychia cabrerae, commonly known as the Cape snowflake, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, succulent habit and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are fleshy and often covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss in arid conditions. Paronychia cabrerae is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
